channel.title: Deployment on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Deployment on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Quota and deployment troubleshooting tools for Azure Functions Flex Consumption
item.description:
Azure Functions Flex Consumption now generally includes platform-integrated tools to troubleshoot quota availability and deployment behavior.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for mid-February 2026
item.description:
Mid-February 2026 Azure SQL preview adds new Visual Studio Code publishing support for SQL Projects and introduces a Connections Migration dialog to import existing workflows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: .NET Framework 3.5 Moves to Standalone Deployment in new versions of Windows
item.description:
.NET Framework 3.5 servicing on newer Windows versions changes to a standalone deployment model rather than being serviced as part of the OS image.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: devops+ai: ðŸ”¥AWS AgentCore Agentic Slack Bot - Full Architecture and CodeðŸ”¥
item.description:
A short post announcing a full-architecture and code walkthrough for an AWS AgentCore agentic Slack bot, with an enthusiastic call to deploy it.

  • Source: Let’s do DevOps

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.19 is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) 3.19 is now generally available. The release focuses on improving deployment efficiency, expanding monitoring capabilities, strengthening code security, and refining policy management with a more intuitive flow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.19 release candidate is now available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) 3.19 release candidate is now available, focusing on improved deployment efficiency, enhanced monitoring, stronger code security, and better policy management with a more intuitive flow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Functions support for Java 25
item.description:
Azure Functions now offers public preview support for Java 25, allowing local development and deployment to Azure Functions on both Windows and Linux with benefits including enhanced security and extended support.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Deployment labels in Azure Container Apps
item.description:
Azure Container Apps now supports deployment labels in public preview as a new deployment mode. This feature simplifies environment management and enables advanced deployment strategies by letting you assign meaningful names to deployments.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Functions support for Python 3.13
item.description:
Azure Functions now generally supports Python 3.13: you can develop functions locally with Python 3.13 and deploy them to Azure. Alongside this release, Functions introduces an opt-in runtime version control feature that lets you target specific versions of the Functions Python runtime.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.18 is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) 3.18 is now generally available. The release focuses on improving deployment efficiency, monitoring, code security, and policy management, and introduces the ability for enterprise administrators to define custom properties.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Functions .NET 10 support
item.description:
Azure Functions now supports .NET 10 in Public Preview. To use it, change the Functions project’s target framework and update Microsoft.Azure.Functions.Worker.Sdk to version 2.0.5 or later. The announcement also indicates .NET 10 projects can be deployed to app (source content truncated).

  • Source: Azure Updates
